714.description: Clarifies the definition of "bicycles" for purposes of county vehicular taxes, highway safety laws, statewide traffic code, and bicycle laws by adding "low-speed electric bicycles" and defining low-speed electric bicycles. Excludes low-speed electric bicycles from the definitions of "moped", "motor vehicle", and "vehicle". Prohibits low-speed electric bicycle riding on all sidewalks. Effective 3/15/2038. (SD2)

715.last_action: Conference Committee Meeting will reconvene on Friday, 05-01-15 at 4:03PM in Conference Room 423.
715.title: Innovative Business Interaction Program; Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism; Hawaii Tourism Authority; Appropriation ($)
715.description: Establishes an innovative business interaction program under DBEDT, with the assistance of the Hawaii Tourism Authority. Allocates a portion of transient accommodations tax revenues for the program. Appropriates funds. Takes effect on 2/19/2025. (SD2)

716.last_action: Referred to JUD, FIN, referral sheet 2
716.title: Marijuana; Legalization; Taxation
716.description: Legalizes under state law the growing, processing, possession, transfer, and personal use of marijuana in a specified quantity to persons at least twenty-one years of age. Requires licensing to operate marijuana establishments. Subjects marijuana establishments to excise taxes and income taxes.

717.last_action: The committee(s) on EDB recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
717.title: Liquor Tax; Barrel Sales
717.description: Establishes a reduced per gallon tax rate on beer sold in barrels for the first 60,000 barrels sold annually. Effective 1/1/2016.

718.title: General Obligation Bonds; CIP; Lahaina Flood Control Project ($)
718.description: Authorizes the issuance of GO bonds and appropriates funds for the Lahaina Flood Control Project. Requires the appropriation to be matched by county funds. (HB719 HD1)

719.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Ito excused (1).
719.title: Ocean Recreation Management; Advisory Committee
719.description: Makes permanent the west Maui ocean recreation management area advisory committee. Adds one member to the committee with a background in ocean safety. (HB720 HD1)

720.last_action: Referred to OMH/WAL, JUD, referral sheet 2
720.title: Beach Access; Reasonable Accommodation; Ocean Recreation Management Area
720.description: Requires reasonable accommodations for disabled persons to access the beach.

721.title: Lipoa Point Management Council; DNLR; Appropriation ($)
721.description: Establishes a Lipoa point management council in DLNR for the development of Lipoa point. Appropriates moneys for land surveyor services, maintenance services, and development of a master plan for Lipoa point. (HB722 HD2)

722.last_action: The committee(s) on CPC recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
722.title: Activity Desks; Exemptions; Fiduciaries; Client Trust Accounts; Reports
722.description: Requires activity desks to designate fiduciaries in case of certain business closures and to submit monthly financial reports to DCCA. Exempts from the law certain activity desks that operate without compensation. (HB723 HD1)

723.last_action: The committee(s) on EDB/TOU recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
723.title: Task Force; Broadband Availability
723.description: Establishes a task force to create a master plan for the availability of universal high speed broadband access in Waikiki and other resort areas.

724.last_action: The committee(s) on CPC recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
724.title: Insurance Premium Tax, Applicability to Mutual Benefit Societies
724.description: Temporarily imposes an insurance premium tax on mutual benefit societies and health maintenance organizations but exempts them from the tax if they do not file for an insurance plan rate increase during that period.

725.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on CPC with Representative(s) Cullen, Har, Jordan, Matsumoto, Oshiro, Pouha, Tokioka voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Fukumoto Chang, McDermott, Thielen, Tupola, Ward voting no (5) and Representative(s) Takumi excused (1).
725.title: Hawaii Health Connector; Insurers; Mandatory Inclusion; Federally-Qualified Health Centers.
725.description: Requires health insurers with greater than 20 percent share of the State's small group health insurance market to offer gold and silver level qualified health plans as a condition of participation in the individual market of the Hawaii Health Connector. Requires the issuer of each qualified plan to offer to contract with federally qualified health centers.

726.title: Hawaii Health Insurance Exchange; Connector; Plans
726.description: Amends the definition of "qualified plan" under the Hawaii Health Connector to specify that a plan must be a bronze, silver, gold, or platinum plan for individual plans and a gold or platinum plan for small business health options program plans. (HB727 HD2)

727.last_action: The committee(s) on HLT recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
727.title: Insurance; Health Organizations; De-identified Claims Data; Disclosure
727.description: Requires a health organization to annually disclose de-identified claims data to Insurance Commissioner. Requires Insurance Commissioner to annually disclose de-identified claims data to a large group purchaser upon request. Exempts de-identified claims data from public disclosure except as provided. Makes conforming amendments.

728.last_action: Referred to HLT, FIN, referral sheet 2
728.title: Colorectal Cancer Screening and Awareness Pilot Program; Department of Health; Appropriation ($)
728.description: Establishes a two-year Hawaii colorectal cancer screening and awareness pilot program using the Hawaii comprehensive breast and cervical cancer control program as a model. Appropriates funds for the pilot program. Repeals on June 30, 2017.

729.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Ito excused (1).
729.title: Administrative Procedure; Administrative Rules; Public Hearings
729.description: Requires state agencies to hold public hearings on proposed administrative rule changes in the counties and on the islands where proposed administrative rule changes will have primary impacts and significant monetary impacts. (HB730 HD1)

730.last_action: Referred to EDN, FIN, referral sheet 2
730.title: Afterschool Programs; Elementary-School Students; Appropriation ($)
730.description: Establishes a five-year evidence-based physical-activity and nutritional-education pilot program within the A+ Program in Hawaii's public elementary schools. Makes appropriations.

731.last_action: Referred to EDN, FIN, referral sheet 2
731.title: After-School Plus (A+) Program; Appropriation ($)
731.description: Appropriates moneys for the After-School Plus (A+) Program.

732.last_action: The committee(s) on CPC recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
732.title: Veterinary Technicians; Veterinary Technology; Registration; Regulation; Board of Veterinary Examiners
732.description: Establishes requirements for the regulation of veterinary technicians and the practice of veterinary technology under chapter 471, Hawaii Revised Statutes, relating to veterinary medicine. Establishes provisions relating to registration requirements, educational requirements, limitations on use of titles, grounds for refusal to grant and revocation or suspension of registration, hearings, and criminal penalties. Requires the board of veterinary examiners to issue certificates of registration to applicants beginning on July 1, 2017.

733.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
733.title: Housing First Program Rental Assistance Payments; Homelessness
733.description: Defines "housing first program rental assistance payments". Allows HHFDC to make housing first program rental assistance payments from sums made available from DHS through the housing first program. Defines "chronically homeless individual". Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

734.last_action: The committee(s) on HSG recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
734.title: Reserved Housing; Requirement
734.description: Establishes graduated requirements for the provision of reserved housing as a condition of development permits for multi-family dwelling units within the jurisdiction of the Hawaii Community Development Authority on a lot greater than 20,000 gross square feet based on the sales price of units within the development.

735.last_action: Referred to HSG, FIN, referral sheet 2
735.title: Hawaii Public Housing Authority; General Obligation Bonds; Kuhio Homes; Kuhio Park Terrace Low Rise ($)
735.description: Authorizes the issuance of general obligation bonds and appropriation to the Hawaii Public Housing Authority for the redevelopment of their Kuhio Homes and Kuhio Park Terrace Low Rise properties.

737.title: Disabled Persons; Misrepresentation as Owner or Trainer of Service Dog
737.description: Establishes a misdemeanor for knowingly misrepresenting oneself as the owner or trainer of a service dog.

738.last_action: The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
738.title: Civil Actions; Service by Publication
738.description: Clarifies the requirements for service by publication.

739.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Pouha excused (1).
739.title: Motor Vehicle Registration; Used Cars
739.description: Authorizes the counties to enter into contracts with dealers and rental car companies for the registration of used cars.

740.last_action: Referred to TRN, CPC, referral sheet 2
740.title: Towing; Vehicle Owner
740.description: Establishes definitions of "hooked up", "scene", and "vehicle owner" to clarify when a vehicle must be released by a towing company. Establishes date and time stamped photo as proof of vehicle being hooked up.

741.last_action: Referred to TRN, CPC/JUD, referral sheet 2
741.title: Motor Carriers; Motor Vehicle Insurance; Transportation Network Companies
741.description: Includes transportation network companies and transportation network drivers in the motor carrier law. Raises motor vehicle liability insurance limits for motor carriers. Excludes motor carrier and taxicabs from coverage under personal motor vehicle insurance policy unless specifically included.

742.last_action: Referred to EEP, TRN, CPC, referral sheet 2
742.title: Ethanol; Motor Vehicles; Energy Efficiency
742.description: Repeals existing requirement that gasoline for motor vehicles be composed of 10 per cent ethanol.

743.last_action: The committee(s) on CPC recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
743.title: Check Cashing; Deferred Deposit Agreements; Interest
743.description: Places a cap on the interest that a check casher can charge pursuant to a deferred deposit agreement at 36 per cent per annum.

745.last_action: Conference Committee Meeting will reconvene on Friday, 05-01-15 at 4:20PM in Conference Room 325.
745.title: Hawaii Cybersecurity, Economic, Education, and Infrastructure Security Coordinator; Secretary; Civil Service Exempt; Appropriation ($)
745.description: Exempts the Hawaii cybersecurity, economic, education, and infrastructure security coordinator from civil service. Authorizes the coordinator to hire a secretary to assist the coordinator. Appropriates moneys. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD2)

746.last_action: Referred to JUD, FIN, referral sheet 2
746.title: Marriage; Annulment, Divorce, or Separation; Domicile and Physical Presence Requirements
746.description: Repeals the provision allowing actions for annulment, divorce, or separation of a marriage solemnized in this State, where the parties do not meet state domicile or physical presence requirements, if the parties are domiciled in a jurisdiction that does not recognize the marriage.

747.title: General Excise Tax; Nicotine
747.description: Applies the general excise tax on the manufacture and sale, at wholesale and retail, of all products containing nicotine, at a rate of 10%. Applies to gross income and gross proceeds received after 12/31/2016.

748.last_action: The committee on CPN deferred the measure.
748.title: Cigarettes; Fee; Litter; Beach Clean-Up Special Fund ($)
748.description: Imposes on wholesalers and dealers a beach clean-up cigarette fee per cigarette sold, used, or possessed. Establishes and allocates moneys generated to the Beach Clean-Up Special Fund for litter removal from beach land.

749.last_action: Referred to WAL, JUD, referral sheet 3
749.title: Sandalwood; DLNR
749.description: Establishes penalties for the destruction or harvesting of native sandalwood trees. Requires replanting for trees harvested. Bans the export of raw or unprocessed sandalwood timber. Establishes DLNR policies regarding sandalwood.

750.last_action: Referred to TRN, WAL, FIN, referral sheet 3
750.title: Appraisals; Airports; Leases; Department of Transportation
750.description: Establishes a mandatory, periodic appraisal of airport lands that are leased to the public.

751.last_action: Referred to CPC, JUD, referral sheet 3
751.title: Deposit Advance Products; Prohibition
751.description: Prohibits check cashers from offering deposit advance products to customers.

752.title: Taxation; Personal Exemption; Conformance
752.description: Conforms the State personal exemption amount to the federal personal exemption amount.

753.last_action: Referred to HLT, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 3
753.title: Food Service Containers
753.description: Prohibits restaurants, food establishments, and food packagers from providing food in polystyrene foam containers beginning 1/1/16. Requires the use of compostable food containers. Authorizes DOH to allow exemptions.

754.last_action: Referred to AGR, CPC, referral sheet 3
754.title: Seals of Quality; Production Within State
754.description: Codifies the requirement under section 4-135-1, HAR, that seals of quality may be used only for fresh agricultural products produced entirely within the State and value added processed agricultural and food products for which the primary agricultural product has been produced entirely within the State. Grandfathers existing licenses for use of the seals.

755.last_action: The committee(s) on LMG recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
755.title: Audiovisual Technology; Videoconferencing; Legislative Hearings; Testimony; Teleconferencing; Neighbor Islands ($)
755.description: Requires both chambers of the legislature to implement rules to permit residents to present testimony through audiovisual technology. Appropriates moneys to establish audiovisual systems throughout the State.

756.last_action: Referred to EEP, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 3
756.title: Energy Storage; Tax Credit; Investment; Utilization; Energy Storage Portfolio Standards; Appropriation ($)
756.description: Establishes an income tax credit for each grid-connected energy storage property that is installed and placed in service in the State during the taxable year beginning after 12/31/2015; provided that this tax credit shall not be available for taxable years beginning after 12/31/2026. Allows the tax credit to be claimed as either an investment credit or utilization credit. Appropriates moneys to administer the tax credit. Requires the Public Utilities Commission to establish and periodically revise energy storage portfolio standards and report to the Legislature.

757.last_action: Referred to LAB, EDN, FIN, referral sheet 3
757.title: Teachers; Salary Credit; Teacher Shortage Area
757.description: Prohibits limits on the amount of professional experience credit DOE can grant to teachers hired for teacher shortage areas.

758.title: Public Schools; Ideal Room Temperature; Appropriation ($)
758.description: Requires DOE and DAGS, in consultation with the State Energy Office of DBEDT and Hawaii Natural Energy Institute of UH, to develop a cooling master strategy and comprehensive retrofitting study for public schools and to report findings to the Legislature. Authorizes general obligation bonds and appropriates funds for efficient classroom-cooling demonstration projects. (HB759 HD1)

759.last_action: The committee(s) on FIN recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
759.title: General Excise Tax; Surcharge; State Reimbursement
759.description: Changes the State's automatic deduction of the gross proceeds of a county's surcharge on state tax for mass transit to three per cent to reimburse the State for costs associated with handling of the county surcharge on state tax. Requires an annual report of the usage of surcharge accounts.

760.last_action: The committee(s) on TRN recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
760.title: Heavy Trucks; Driving Left-Most Lane; Prohibition
760.description: Prohibits heavy trucks from driving in the left-most lane of an interstate freeway except under certain conditions.

761.last_action: Referred to EDN, FIN, referral sheet 3
761.title: Kindergarten; Entry Cut-off
761.description: Changes the kindergarten entry cut-off date from July 31 to December 31 of the school year.

762.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
762.title: Seniors; Executive Office on Aging; Intergenerational Playground; Appropriation ($)
762.description: Requires the Executive Office on Aging and the city and county of Honolulu to establish a three-year intergenerational playground pilot program. Requires reports to the Legislature and the mayor of the city and county of Honolulu. Appropriates funds. Repeals on June 30, 2019. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

763.last_action: Re-referred to AGR, FIN, referral sheet 7
763.title: Farm Worker Housing; Agricultural Parks; Non-agricultural Parks; Appropriation ($)
763.description: Allows one or more employee dwellings to be built on an agricultural park lot or non-agricultural park lot that is leased by a long-term lessee with lease terms of at least thirty-five years and a lot size of at least five acres, with restrictions. Appropriates an unspecified amount from the general fund to be expended by the department of agriculture to develop farm worker housing.

764.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and C. Lee excused (1).
764.title: Appropriation; Housing First ($)
764.description: Appropriates funds to the department of human services to continue to administer housing first programs for chronically homeless individuals. (HB765 HD1)

765.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to WAM.

765.description: Makes an appropriation for the construction of micro apartment housing units. (HB766 HD1)

766.last_action: The committee on JDL deferred the measure.

766.description: Provides that certain areas within Hawaii Public Housing Authority housing projects are closed to the public and amends criminal trespass in the second degree to permit the prosecution of an unauthorized entry or a violation of a written prohibition to enter into the subject housing projects. Clarifies requirements for signage notifying trespassers of illegal entry. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

767.last_action: Conference committee meeting to reconvene on 05-01-15 10:30AM in conference room 229.

767.description: Expands the Hawaii public housing authority's power to dispose of property seized, abandoned, or remaining upon eviction in and at public housing projects, elder or elderly housing, or state low-income housing projects. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD2)

768.last_action: Referred to EEP, FIN, referral sheet 3

768.description: Repeals the glass container recovery program.

769.description: Authorizes restaurants with a liquor license to sell beer, malt beverages, or cider for off-premises consumption, under certain conditions. Authorizes retail dealers with a liquor license to sell beer, malt beverages, or cider in non-original packages, under certain conditions. Authorizes brewpubs and small craft producer pubs with a liquor license to sell malt beverages manufactured on the premises or purchased from another liquor licensee for off-premises consumption. (SD1)

770.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with Representative(s) Ward voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Har, Matsumoto excused (2).

770.description: Reenacts the Hawaii Capital Loan Revolving Fund. Appropriates funds to the Hawaii Capital Loan Revolving Fund and funds one permanent full-time program manager position (1.0 FTE) within the Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism. (HB771 HD1)

771.description: Appropriates funds to the state Department of Agriculture to assist and fund the National Wildlife Research Center to research the negative impacts of the rose-ringed parakeet on Kauai and develop and implement a control plan to reduce the negative impacts.

772.description: Establishes a Community Food Forest Program in the Department of Land and Natural Resources to work collaboratively with local government and community organizations to provide sources of healthy food statewide. Appropriates funds.

773.last_action: Conference Committee Meeting will reconvene on Friday, 05-01-15 at 4:46PM in Conference Room 423.
773.title: Small Business Regulatory Review Board; Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism; Appropriation ($)
773.description: Makes an appropriation to the Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism for the Small Business Regulatory Review Board to hire additional staff. Effective 7/1/2053. (SD1)

774.title: International Marketing and Recruitment; Higher Education; Appropriation ($)
774.description: Appropriates funds to the department of business, economic development, and tourism for marketing Hawaii and Hawaii's higher education institutions to international students. (HB775 CD1)

775.description: Requires DOH to implement a pilot project to monitor radiation levels in seafood and seaweed over the next 5 years and to post periodic reports on its website. Makes an appropriation.

776.description: Establishes a state earned income tax credit.

778.last_action: The committee(s) on HUS recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.

778.description: Requests the financial assistance advisory council to assist the department of human services in proposing recommendations to restructure the welfare payment system and report any findings to the legislature.

779.description: Requires that at least one member of the board of education have a minimum of 5 years of classroom teaching experience within the public educational system.

782.description: Proposes a constitutional amendment to provide that the right to freedom of speech does not include the expenditure of money to influence elections.

783.description: Allows for the registration of autocycles as motor vehicles. Allows autocycles to be operated on public roads, streets, or highways. Defines autocycle.

784.description: Raises the motion picture income tax credit for productions in a county with a population of seven hundred thousand or less. Requires the taxpayer claiming the tax credit to verify the county residency of local hires.

785.last_action: The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.

785.description: Requires agencies to exercise reasonable care in the maintenance of all government records under its control that are required to be made available for public inspection.

786.last_action: Referred to CPC, JUD, referral sheet 3

786.description: Establishes acts that are prohibited of any person who practices massage for compensation.

787.last_action: The committee(s) on HLT recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.

787.description: Authorizes the cultivation of medical marijuana. Requires registration with DOH. Requires DOH to adopt rules. Prohibits the infusion of trademarked products with medical marijuana.

788.last_action: The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.

789.last_action: Referred to LAB, JUD, referral sheet 3

789.description: Authorizes the employees' retirement system board of trustees to hold a meeting closed to the public to discuss or decide upon certain matters.

790.description: Corrects errors. Harmonizes age and service requirements for judges who are members of the employees' retirement system with requirements for other contributory plan members.

791.description: Amends the Hawaii Rules of Evidence to authorize nonresident property crime victims to testify in misdemeanor or petty misdemeanor property criminal proceedings by a live two-way video connection. (HB792 HD2)

792.description: Prohibits the slaughter or trafficking of pet animals for human consumption. Specifies that a "pet animal" shall include all dogs and cats.

793.last_action: The committee(s) on HLT recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.

793.description: Provides that a physician may determine what medical condition qualifies a patient to use medical marijuana.

794.last_action: The committee(s) on HLT recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.

794.description: Prohibits an employer from disciplining, suspending, discharging, or discriminating against an employee who is a patient qualified to use medical marijuana solely because the employee tested positive for marijuana use.

795.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with Representative(s) Har, Jordan, McKelvey voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Ito excused (1).

795.description: Requires an entity to send written notice to a health care provider at least thirty calendar days prior to initiating any recoupment or offset demand efforts. Prohibits an entity from initiating any recoupment or offset efforts more than twelve months after an initial claim payment was received by a health care provider, with specific exceptions. (HB796 HD1)

797.last_action: Referred to EDN, FIN, referral sheet 3
797.title: Public Schools; Early Childhood Education; Junior Kindergarten; Appropriation ($)
797.description: Establishes junior kindergartens to provide schooling for children who turn five between August 1 and January 1 of a given school year, and would otherwise be required to wait until after their fifth birthday to enroll in kindergarten. Requires the department of education to create a strategic plan for implementation of junior kindergarten programs and report findings to the legislature. Appropriates funds for the reinstatement of junior kindergarten programs in schools where the programs were administered prior to 2012.

798.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and C. Lee excused (1).
798.title: Uniform Aeronautics Act
798.description: Clarifies the authority of the State, its employees, or its independent contractors, to remove birds or animals by aerial means in furtherance of official State duties. (HB799 HD1)

799.description: Places the state foundation on culture and the arts within the department of business, economic development, and tourism creative industries division instead of the department of accounting and general services. 800.description: Authorizes the issuance of special purpose revenue bonds to SunStrong LLC, a renewable energy developer, for the provision of electric energy and installation of renewable energy projects in Hawaii. (HD1)

801.description: Provides the counties with exclusive authority to amend district boundaries for lands in the urban district.

802.last_action: The committee(s) on TOU recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.

803.title: CIP; 24th Representative District ($)
803.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 24th Representative District.

804.last_action: Conference committee meeting to reconvene on 05-01-15 2:30PM in conference room 312.

804.description: Exempts federal veterans' disability benefits from claims of creditors and attachment, levy, and seizure to enforce a court judgment, except in certain child and spousal support cases. Effective 01/07/2059. (SD1)

805.last_action: The committee(s) on VMI recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.

805.description: Prohibits courts, in making a disposition of property pursuant to a divorce decree, from considering federal disability benefits awarded to a military veteran.

806.last_action: The committee(s) on VMI recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.

806.description: Prohibits courts from considering a person's federal veterans disability benefits in determining whether to award support and maintenance allowances or the amount of the allowance to the person's spouse or former spouse.

807.title: Taxation; Distribution of Partial Payment
807.description: Requires that partial payment of taxes be credited first to principal, then to interest, and then to penalties.

808.description: Lowers the current interest rate payable by taxpayers on underpayments or nonpayments of tax from the rate of two-thirds of one per cent for each month or fraction thereof to the rate of one-third of one per cent for each month or fraction thereof.

809.title: Philosophy Education; Public Schools; Appropriations ($)
809.description: Appropriates funds for the P4C Program of the University of Hawaii Uehiro Academy for Philosophy and Ethics in Education and for teachers of the Department of Education to train with the P4C Program.

810.description: Appropriates moneys for two full-time equivalent graduate assistant positions at the Hawaii educational policy center at UH. (HB811 HD1)

811.last_action: The committee(s) on TRN recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
811.title: Street Lights; Energy Efficiency ($)
811.description: Requires that new and retrofitted street lights on state highways and roads be energy efficient. Requires that a portion of existing street lights be retrofitted with energy efficient lighting fixtures. Appropriates moneys.

812.title: Ethics Code; Task Force
812.description: Clarifies the fair treatment law by separating out certain limitations placed on task force members from those placed on legislators. Makes clear that legislators are not prohibited from making statements or taking action in the exercise of their legislative functions. (HB813 HD3)

813.title: Road Maintenance; Grant-in-Aid

814.description: Requires the annual registration and inspection of mopeds. Makes mopeds subject to the vehicle weight tax and an annual $15 registration fee. Increases the fine for modifying a moped to $1,000.

815.last_action: The committee(s) on EEP recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.

815.description: Establishes requirements for air quality samples that are taken in emissions investigations within urban districts.

816.last_action: Referred to EEP, CPC, referral sheet 3

816.description: Prohibits the sale or promotional offering of cleaning products and personal care products that contain microplastic.

818.last_action: Conference committee meeting to reconvene on 05-01-15 4:15PM in conference room 329.

835.last_action: The committee(s) on HLT recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.

835.description: Appropriates funds for each year of the 2015-2017 fiscal biennium to establish at least one additional assertive community treatment team for mental health outreach and case management.

Exempts personal possession, acquisition by inheritance, and certain items with an ivory content of less than twenty percent by volume from registration. (HB837 HD2)

837.description: Requires the boards of water supply to fluoridate public water systems with 1,000 or more service connections. Requires the Department of Health, with the cooperation of the boards of water supply, to submit a report to the legislature regarding implementation of fluoridating the public water systems.

838.description: Exempts the State and counties from laws or rules that require the performance of construction, reconstruction, preservation, resurfacing, restoration, or rehabilitation upon a private highway if it had been surrendered to the State or a county and the legislature or county council adopts a legislative measure accepting the surrender.

839.last_action: The committee on WAM deferred the measure.

839.description: Requires the department of public safety to construct a multi-story correctional facility at the Halawa correctional facility to replace the existing Oahu community correctional center. 899.description: Clarifies that fraudulently applying for or renewing medical assistance benefits is a class C felony and specifies restitution amount chargeable for a violation. Applies extended statute of limitations for felonies involving fraud or deception to medical assistance fraud. (HB900 HD1)

900.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Pouha excused (1).
900.title: Law Enforcement Vehicles
900.description: Allows the Department of the Attorney General and the Harbors Division of the Department of Transportation to have law enforcement vehicles, with lights and sirens, that are recognized authorized emergency vehicles.

901.title: Acquisition of Firearms by Lawful Permanent Resident Aliens
901.description: Makes it clear that the police may grant applications to acquire firearms to lawful permanent resident aliens.

902.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Oshiro, Souki excused (2).
902.title: Department of the Attorney General; Emergency Appropriation ($)
902.description: Makes an emergency appropriation to the Department of the Attorney General for retention of expert witnesses and specialized legal counsel in major litigation against the State of Hawaii.

903.last_action: Referred to AGR/TOU, FIN, referral sheet 4
903.title: Agricultural Tourism; Overnight Accommodations; Bona Fide Farmer
903.description: Allows for overnight accommodations for bona fide farming operations. Defines bona fide farming operations.

904.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Oshiro excused (1).
904.title: State Planning Act; Office of Planning; Appropriation ($)
904.description: Requires the Office of Planning to review and propose updates to the State Planning Act and submit a written report to the Legislature. Appropriates unspecified funds. Effective July 1, 2015. (HB905 HD1)

905.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to WAM.
905.title: General Excise Tax Exemptions for Certified or Approved Housing Projects
905.description: Ensures that certain eligible housing projects will remain affordable for certain minimum periods to be certified for exemption from general excise taxes. (HB906 HD1)

906.last_action: Referred to LAB, FIN, referral sheet 4
906.title: Appropriations for Collective Bargaining Cost Items ($)
906.description: To provide fund authorizations and appropriations for collective bargaining cost items for Unit (14) and their excluded counterparts, including the cost of salary adjustments negotiated between the State and the bargaining unit representative for fiscal biennium 20152017.

914.last_action: Referred to LAB, FIN, referral sheet 4
914.title: Appropriations for Collective Bargaining Cost Items
914.description: To provide fund authorizations and appropriations for collective bargaining cost items for Unit (9) and their excluded counterparts, including the cost of salary adjustments negotiated between the State and the bargaining unit representative for fiscal biennium 20152017.

918.last_action: Referred to LAB, FIN, referral sheet 4
918.title: Employees' Retirement System; Unused Sick Leave Credit For Public Employees
918.description: Changes the formula for crediting unused sick leave to retirement benefits for public employees who become members of the Employees' Retirement System after June 30, 2015.

919.last_action: Referred to LAB, FIN, referral sheet 4
919.title: Retirement service credit; workers' compensation benefits
919.description: Requires an employee receiving workers' compensation benefits to have retirement contributions deducted from those benefits. Establishes deadlines: (1) for public employees who join the employees' retirement system after June 30, 2016 to claim membership service credit for previous service and for military service credit; and (2) for starting payments to acquire membership service credit for previous service, military service and unpaid leave. Provides for payment for acquisition based on actuarial cost.

920.last_action: Referred to LAB, FIN, referral sheet 4
920.title: Employees' Retirement System; Payroll and Personnel Transactions
920.description: Requires State and counties to furnish payroll and personnel transaction information to the Employees' Retirement System in the required format. If a department or agency fails to provide the information in the required format, the State or county will be required to pay to the system in a lump sum at the beginning of the fiscal year the amount equal to the employer contributions payable by the department or agency. Unpaid amounts bear interest.

922.title: Department of Budget and Finance
922.description: Repeal of various non-general fund accounts and transfers the balance of the fee simple residential revolving fund to the general fund.

923.last_action: Referred to CPC/JUD, FIN, referral sheet 4
923.title: Mortgage Servicers
923.description: Clarifies mortgage servicer requirements under chapter 454M, Hawaii Revised Statutes, including licensing requirements, crediting of payments, escrows for payment of taxes and insurance, payoff statements, delinquencies and loss mitigation efforts, borrower complaints, fee disclosures, record maintenance, assignment of servicing rights, and prohibited activities. Establishes bonding requirements.

924.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Takumi excused (1).
924.title: Insurance
924.description: Updates title 24 of the Hawaii Revised Statutes relating to insurance.

925.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Ito excused (1).
925.title: Health Insurance
925.description: Updates Title 24 of the Hawaii Revised Statutes relating to health insurance. (HB926 HD1)

926.last_action: Report adopted. referred to the committee(s) on FIN as amended in HD 1 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Ito excused (1).
926.title: On-bill Financing; On-bill Repayment; Public Utilities Commission; Electric Utilities; Billing and Collections; Tax Exemption
926.description: Exempts electric utilities acting as billing and collections agents for an on-bill program from various State taxes and State laws regulating financial institutions, escrow depositories, or collection agencies. Effective 7/1/2112.

927.title: Consumer Advocate; Public Utilities Commission; Violations; Regulatory Proceedings
927.description: Clarifies section 269-15(a), Hawaii Revised Statutes, so that the Public Utilities Commission may order the Consumer Advocate, rather than the Director of the Department of Commerce and Consumer Affairs, to appear in regulatory proceedings initiated by the Commission to enforce chapter 269, Hawaii Revised Statutes, and related requirements.

929.title: Emergency Appropriation for the Office of the Governor ($)
929.description: Makes an emergency appropriation for fiscal year 2014-2015 for the Office of the Governor to meet payroll shortfalls.

931.last_action: Report adopted. referred to the committee(s) on FIN as amended in HD 2 with Representative(s) Rhoads voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Pouha excused (1).
931.title: Civil Service Exemption; Hawaii Public Housing Authority; Public Housing Renovations
931.description: Extends the exemption from state civil service for persons hired or contracted to repair and maintain vacant state housing units. Repeals requirement for termination or conversion to civil service status on July 1, 2015. (HB932 HD2)

932.last_action: Referred to HLT/HUS, FIN, referral sheet 4
932.title: Hospital Sustainability Program; Hospital Sustainability Program Special Fund
932.description: Amend Act 217, Session Laws of Hawaii 2012, as amended by Act 141, Session Laws of Hawaii 2013 and Act 123, Session Laws of Hawaii 2014, to continue the Hospital Sustainability Program by extending the sunset date of the Act, updating the referral dates in the statute, and to revise the funding amount for the hospital sustainability program for fiscal year 2015-2016. Effective June 29, 2015.

933.last_action: Referred to HLT/HUS, FIN, referral sheet 4
933.title: Nursing Facility Sustainability Program; Nursing Facility Sustainability Program Special Fund ($)
933.description: Amends Act 156, Session Laws of Hawaii 2012, as amended by Act 142, Session Laws of Hawaii 2013, and as amended by Act 124, Session Laws of Hawaii 2014, to continue the Nursing Facility Sustainability Program by extending the sunset date of the Act, updating the referral dates in the statute, and appropriating funding out of the nursing facility sustainability program special fund for fiscal year 2015-2016. Effective June 29, 2015.

934.last_action: Referred to VMI, HSG, FIN, referral sheet 4
934.title: Hawaii Public Housing Authority; Exemption From Works of Art Assessment
934.description: Exempts the Hawaii Public Housing Authority from the one per cent transfer of appropriated capital improvement funds to the Works of Art Special Fund.

935.last_action: The committee(s) on HSG recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
935.title: Hawaii Public Housing Authority; Disposition of Property Abandoned, Seized, or Remaining at Federal and State Public Housing Properties
935.description: Expands the Hawaii Public Housing Authority's authority to dispose of property seized, abandoned, or remaining in federal, elder or elderly, or state low-income housing projects, including property remaining upon eviction.

936.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and C. Lee excused (1).
936.title: Medicaid Managed Care Program
936.description: Replaces outdated references to QUEST and QUEST Expanded Access in the Hawaii Revised Statutes with the terms "medicaid managed care" or "medicaid managed care programs." (HB937 HD1)

937.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0).
937.title: General Support for General Assistance Payments (HMS 204); Emergency Appropriation ($)
937.description: Makes an emergency appropriation from the general revenues of the State of Hawaii for fiscal year 2014-2015 to address the budget shortfall for the general support for the General Assistance Program (HMS 204) in the Department of Human Services. (HB938 HD1)

938.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Pouha excused (1).
938.title: Amendments to Birth Certificates, Establishment of Parenthood
938.description: Clarifies that amendments to birth records that change parenthood shall not be conducted through the Uniform Information Practices Act procedures to correct personal records, but must be pursuant to a court order of appropriate jurisdiction or other legal establishment of parenthood.

939.title: Regulation of Tobacco Products
939.description: Amends Chapter 328J, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to prohibit the use of electronic smoking devices in places where smoking is prohibited. (HB940 HD1)

941.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Pouha excused (1).
941.title: Water Infrastructure; Transfer of Funds
941.description: Establishes the authority to transfer federal capitalization grant funds between the Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund and the Drinking Water Treatment Revolving Loan Fund within the Department of Health, in accordance with the existing federal Safe Drinking Water Act, and as codified in Title 40 Code of Federal Regulations section 35.3530(c). Effective July 1, 2015.

942.title: Civil Monetary Penalty Special Fund; Medicare Penalties; Appropriation ($)
942.description: Establishes the Civil Monetary Penalty Special Fund for the deposit of moneys from federal fines assessed against skilled nursing facilities and home health agencies pursuant to inspections conducted by the Department of Health on behalf of the U.S. Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS). Appropriates funds to the Department of Health for purposes approved by CMS. (HB943 CD1)

943.last_action: Referred to HLT, JUD, referral sheet 4
943.title: Background Checks; Employees, Prospective Employees, Applicants, or Operators of Healthcare Facilities and the State Department of Health
943.description: Expand the authority of the Department of Health to conduct background checks to include criminal history record check, adult abuse perpetrator and child abuse record checks, and certified nurse aide registry record checks for persons seeking employment with the State or its contractors where the work involves direct client care, and applicants and operators of healthcare facilities.

944.last_action: The committee(s) on HLT recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
944.title: Online Posting of Inspection Reports of Care Facilities
944.description: Extends the date by which the Department of Health must post inspection reports for state-licensed care facilities by six months and increases the number of days to post the reports, as recommended by a legislative task force.

945.last_action: Referred to HLT, CPC, referral sheet 4
945.title: Building Design Review, Disabilities and Communications Access Board
945.description: Exempts from mandatory review by the Disabilities and Communications Access Board certain construction projects constructed on state or county lands that would not ordinarily be open to public access.

946.last_action: Received notice of Senate conferees (Sen. Com. No. 641).
946.title: Fitness to Proceed; Hawaii State Hospital; Court Ordered Examination Reports
946.description: Creates consistency between statutes pertaining to unfit to proceed and acquit and commit regarding the Hawaii state hospital receiving copies of court ordered examination reports upon commitment to the hospital or conditional release. (SD1)

947.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and C. Lee excused (1).
947.title: Hawaii Health Systems Corporation ($)
947.description: Makes an emergency appropriation to the Hawaii Health Systems Corporation. (HB948 HD1)

948.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Oshiro excused (1).
948.title: Emergency Appropriation; Hazard Evaluation and Emergency Response Preparedness. ($)
948.description: Makes an emergency appropriation to the Department of Health to support public health and environmental hazard evaluation and emergency response preparedness.

949.last_action: The committee(s) on LAB recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
949.title: State Budget; Department of Labor and Industrial Relations
949.description: Amends a budget proviso for the Department of Labor and Industrial Relations to clarify the projected cost of annual vacation payouts by the Department during fiscal year 2014-2015.

950.description: Allows the Labor and Industrial Relations Appeals Board (Board) the option to provide notice of hearing by online posting on the Board's webpage if service by first class mail fails to elicit a response from the party. Requires that the online posting be removed from the webpage no less than five business days after the date of the hearing. (HB951 HD1)

951.title: Public Works Law; Complaints
951.description: Ensures confidentiality of a complainant in an investigation of wage and hour violations for public works projects. (HB952 CD1)

952.last_action: Referred to LAB, FIN, referral sheet 4
952.title: Wage and Hour Law; Minimum Compensation Exemption
952.description: Increases the amount of guaranteed monthly compensation required to exempt an individual from minimum wage, overtime, and record keeping requirements under the Hawaii Wage and Hour Law by way of a formula.

953.last_action: The committee(s) on WAL recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
953.title: Transient Accommodations Tax; Special Land and Development Fund
953.description: Clarifies the distribution and allowable uses of Transient Accommodations Tax funds allocated and deposited into the Special Land and Development Fund in accordance with the Hawaii Tourism Authority's Strategic Plan.

954.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and C. Lee excused (1).

954.description: Clarifies that a person at least eighteen years of age need not obtain a marine surveyor's inspection nor provide documentation that the person is the owner of a vessel in order to be placed on a waitlist for a use permit to moor a vessel in a state small boat harbor.

955.last_action: The committee(s) on WAL recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
955.title: Special Shoreline Encroachment Easements
955.description: Provides the Board of Land and Natural Resources discretion to grant easements for less than fair market value for structures that were authorized by a governmental authority and legally constructed landward of the shoreline within the record boundary of the landward property at the time of construction, but are now located seaward of the valid certified shoreline on public land.

956.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and C. Lee excused (1).
956.title: Forest Stewardship Program
956.description: Clarifies conditions that must be met by applicants to receive funds under the Forest Stewardship Program.

957.last_action: The committee(s) on WAL recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
957.title: Cultural and Natural Resources; Civil Enforcement of Resource Violations
957.description: Provides alternative civil enforcement options that may be utilized by the Board of Land and Natural Resources in the processing of natural and cultural resource violation cases.

958.last_action: The committee(s) on HUS recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
958.title: After-School Programs; Resources for Enrichment, Athletics, Culture, and Health Program
958.description: Establishes the R.E.A.C.H. (resources for enrichment, athletics, culture, and health) program in the Office of Youth Services to provide a framework and funding base for after-school programs in public middle and intermediate schools. Establishes a revolving fund to receive fees and other moneys to supplement the costs of administering and operating the program.

959.last_action: Referred to JUD, FIN, referral sheet 4
959.title: Commissioners of Deeds; Rules; Fees ($)
959.description: Adds new sections to chapter 503B, Hawaii Revised Statutes to clarify the Lieutenant Governor's rulemaking authority, authority to assess and collect fees and administrative fines, and to establish a revolving fund into which the fees and administrative fines are to be deposited. Amends chapter 503B, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to clarify that the Lieutenant Governor is responsible for the program and increases the surety bond requirement from $1,000 to $10,000.

960.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on HLT with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0).
960.title: Correctional Facilities; Court Orders to Provide Medical Treatment for Inmates and Detainees
960.description: Allows for a declaration to be filed with the petition as an alternative to an affidavit; expands the court's ability to continue the hearing on the petition for good cause; gives the court more flexibility in deciding when a guardian ad litem is necessary; changes the time requirement for filing for a court order for medical treatment from a period of within two days of an examination of the person to within five days; redefines the persons who must be notified of the petition; clarifies the effective expiration date of the order for persons who return to custody after release; and provides the ability for the department to seek an extension of an order to treat if necessary.

961.last_action: Referred to HLT, JUD, referral sheet 4
961.title: Uniform Controlled Substances Act
961.description: Updates chapter 329, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to make it consistent with amendments in federal law on controlled substances; amends section 329-20 to add new controlled substances federally scheduled as required under section 329-11.

962.title: Public Safety
962.description: Includes misdemeanor offenses under chapter 134 (Firearms, Ammunition and Dangerous Weapons), Hawaii Revised Statutes, to the offenses that disqualify parolees from the provisions of Act 139, Session Laws of Hawaii 2012.

963.title: Income Tax; Conformity to the Internal Revenue Code for 2014
963.description: Conforms Hawaii income tax law with amendments made to the Internal Revenue Code as of December 31, 2014.

964.title: Estate and Generation-skipping Transfer Tax Reform Act
964.description: Conforms chapter 236E, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended as of December 31, 2014, and makes technical, nonsubstantive changes.

965.title: General Excise Tax; Nonprofit Organizations
965.description: Corrects the inadvertent repeal of wording from section 237-23, Hawaii Revised Statutes and provides a retroactive effective date. (HB 966 HD1)

966.title: Income Tax; Vocational Rehabilitation Referrals
966.description: Amends section 235-55.91(e), Hawaii Revised Statutes, by updating references to the Internal Revenue Code.

967.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
967.title: Taxes; Liability for Amounts Passed on as Tax
967.description: Establishes that a taxpayer is liable for any amounts passed on and separately stated as the tax owed by the taxpayer for the transaction in a receipt, contract, invoice, billing, or other evidence of the business activity. Provides for civil penalty and reporting of violations to the department of commerce and consumer affairs. Takes effect 01/07/2059. (SD1)

968.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with Representative(s) DeCoite, Matsumoto voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Fukumoto Chang, McDermott, Thielen, Tupola, Ward voting no (5) and Representative(s) Ito excused (1).

968.description: Establishes a standard maintenance fee to be collected from all driver's license applicants to support computer and software maintenance and updates for the driver licensing program.

969.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with Representative(s) Fukumoto Chang, Thielen, Tupola voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Pouha excused (1).
969.title: Highway; Safety; Motor Vehicle Inspections; Motor Carrier Vehicle Inspections
969.description: Expands authority of the Director of Transportation over required motor vehicle and motor carrier vehicle inspections in the State.

970.title: Aloha Tower Development Corporation; Board of Directors
970.description: Amends the composition of the board of directors of the Aloha Tower development corporation. Repeals the position of chief executive officer. (SD2)

971.last_action: Referred to TRN , JUD, referral sheet 4
971.title: Aeronautics; Department of Transportation Rules; Dillingham Airfield
971.description: Clarifies the authority of the Department of Transportation at Dillingham Airfield.

972.last_action: Referred to TRN, JUD, FIN, referral sheet 4
972.title: Highway Safety; Ignition Interlock; Motor Vehicle
972.description: Amends the law for operating a vehicle under the influence of an intoxicant. Mandates the use of an ignition interlock for all offenders convicted and adjudicated for the offense of operating a vehicle under the influence of an intoxicant. Increases the fines for the violation. Removes the exemption for the repeat offender to drive without an ignition interlock if employed and required to drive a company vehicle for employment. Authorizes the director of transportation to make administrative rules governing the certification, monitoring, operation and compliance of the ignition interlock and authorizes penalties under these rules.

973.last_action: Referred to HED, JUD, referral sheet 4
973.title: University of Hawaii; Rulemaking; Adoption of Regulations
973.description: Exempt certain adoption of regulations by the University of Hawaii from chapter 91, Hawaii Revised Statutes; require certain adoption of regulations by the University of Hawaii be subject to chapter 92, Hawaii Revised Statutes.

974.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and C. Lee excused (1).
974.title: State Ethics Code; University of Hawaii
974.description: Clarifies application of State Ethics Code to technology transfer arrangements supported by the University of Hawaii. (HB975 HD1)

975.last_action: Referred to HED, FIN, referral sheet 4
975.title: University of Hawaii-West Oahu; Revolving Fund ($)
975.description: Creates a conference center revolving fund for the University of Hawaii-West Oahu.

976.last_action: Referred to HED, FIN, referral sheet 4

976.description: Amends the sunset provisions, with respect to the University of Hawaii, under sections 40-1, 40-2, 40-4, 40-6, 40-58, and 40-81, Hawaii Revised Statutes.

977.last_action: Referred to HED, FIN, referral sheet 4

977.description: To appropriate moneys out of the University of Hawaii Revenue Bond Fund for renovations, repairs, and improvements to the John A. Burns School of Medicine

978.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Pouha excused (1).

978.description: Establishes a Cybersecurity Employment Training Initiative within the University of Hawaii Community College System; appropriates funds for the operation of the Initiative.

979.description: Requires the AG to conduct an inventory of all untested sexual assault collection kits in the possession of state or county law enforcement agencies; to develop and implement a plan to reduce the backlog of untested sexual assault collection kits; and to report to the legislature.

980.title: UH; College-Credit Equivalency Program; Work and Life Experience
980.description: Requires, rather than authorizes, UH to establish policies and procedures for the awarding of credits for college-level learning gained from work or other life experiences, other than military service covered under current law. Requires UH to report to the Legislature on its progress in awarding the college credits. (HB981 HD1)

981.last_action: Referred to AGR, EDN, FIN, referral sheet 5
981.title: Hawaii Farm-to-School Program; Farm-to-School Coordinator; Appropriation ($)
981.description: Establishes the Hawaii Farm-to-School Program and Farm-to-School Coordinator position. Appropriates moneys.

982.description: Requires DOH, in collaboration with DHS and DHRD, to develop departmental plans to reduce the incidence of diabetes in the State and submit reports to the legislature.

983.title: General Excise Tax; Food; Exemption
983.description: Exempts the sale of food from the general excise tax.

984.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and C. Lee excused (1).

984.description: Requires the UH to finance at least sixty per cent of its operating costs through general funds.

985.description: Transfers OIP from LG to DAGS. Increases the independence of OIP as an administratively attached agency. Clarifies the employment status of OIP attorneys and the civil service exemption for OIP personnel. Appropriates funds to DAGS for administrative support.

986.description: Appropriates moneys from the leaking underground storage tank fund to respond to and the repair of the leaking underground fuel storage tanks at the Red Hill fuel storage facility.

988.last_action: The committee(s) on WAL recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.

988.description: Amends the land conservation fund uses to allow for albizia tree removal. Makes an appropriation to DLNR for the removal of albizia trees on both public and private land.

989.description: Amends the six-year program and financial plan to a four-year program and financial plan. Codifies the statutorily implied mandate that the proposed executive budget submitted by the governor be balanced.

990.last_action: Referred to JUD, FIN, referral sheet 5

990.description: Provides counties with home rule authority to set county surcharges on general excise, income, and use taxes. Allows funds collected via surcharge to be used for public projects.

991.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with Representative(s) DeCoite, Fukumoto Chang, Har, Oshiro, Tupola, Ward voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Thielen voting no (1) and Representative(s) Ito excused (1).

Requires that a certification form provided by DOH to register a medical marijuana patient and provide the patient's consent for the release of medical information shall specify that the consent applies to information from a primary care or specialist physician.

993.title: CIP; 43rd Representative District ($)
993.description: Authorizes issuance of general obligation bonds and appropriates funds for capital improvement projects in the 43rd representative district.

994.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.

994.description: Directs the DOA to provide grants to support existing whole system approach, on-farm mentoring programs. Appropriates unspecified sums to the Future Farmers of America program and, as a grant, to the Hawaii 4-H Foundation to educate and support youth in agriculture careers. Takes effect 7/1/2112. (SD1)

995.last_action: Referred to EEP/WAL, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 5
995.title: BLNR; Mineral Resources; Geothermal Resources
995.description: Establishes a framework to regulate geothermal resources development through a permitting process administered by the BLNR and the appropriate county authority. Requires penalties, fees, and costs collected pursuant to chapter 182, HRS, to be deposited into the special land and development fund.

996.last_action: Referred to HLT, CPC, referral sheet 5
996.title: Chiropractic; Scope of Practice
996.description: Updates the scope of practice for chiropractic to reflect standards, practices, and terminology accepted by the National Board of Chiropractic Examiners.

997.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and C. Lee excused (1).
997.title: Public Safety; Incarcerated Parent Data
997.description: Requires the Department of Public Safety to collect data on the number of incoming offenders into the state correctional system who are parents, the number of children they have that are under the age of eighteen, and any other relevant data that the Department deems useful to assist these at-risk children. Requires the committee on weights to incorporate into the weighted student formula weights that account for special education teachers and support staff, enrollment increases, and the optimal student-teacher ratio at each grade level.

1105.title: CIP; 4th Representative District ($)
1105.description: Authorizes issuance of general obligation bonds and appropriates moneys for capital improvement projects in the 4th representative district.

1106.title: Bookmobile; Big Island; Educational Materials; Hawaii State Public Library System; Appropriation ($)
1106.description: Appropriates funds for the establishment and maintenance of a bookmobile that shall serve the rural areas of the island of Hawaii. (HB1107 HD1)

1107.last_action: Re-referred to HLT, FIN, referral sheet 17
1107.title: Mandatory Health Insurance Coverage; Autism Spectrum Disorders
1107.description: Requires health insurers, mutual benefit societies, and health maintenance organizations to provide coverage for autism spectrum disorder treatments. (HB1108 HD1)

1108.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Ito excused (1).
1108.title: Behavior Support Review Committee for Persons with Developmental and Intellectual Disabilities
1108.description: Describes the behavioral support review process for multidisciplinary reviews of restraints or seclusion of persons with developmental or intellectual disabilities. Exempts those who participate in the reviews from liability for authorized disclosure of information. (HB1109 HD1)

1109.last_action: Referred to HLT, FIN, referral sheet 6
1109.title: Oral Health Status; Comprehensive Assessment; Appropriation
1109.description: Requires the Department of Health to develop a comprehensive assessment of Hawaii's oral health status. Appropriates funds.

1110.last_action: Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0).
1110.title: Hawaii Health Systems Corporation; Copies of Records; Fees
1110.description: Authorizes the Hawaii Health Systems Corporation to set rates for copies of records that are protected from the disclosure requirements of Chapter 92F, Hawaii Revised Statutes. Establishes rates for copies of medical records at the actual cost of preparation within minimum and maximum rates. (HB1111 HD1)

1111.last_action: Received notice of Senate conferees (Sen. Com. No. 641).
1111.title: Hawaii Health Systems Corporation; Audit; Collective Bargaining; Transition; Appropriation ($)
1111.description: Repeals certain limits on operational authority. Requires the auditor to conduct a financial and management audit of HHSC every five years. Authorizes HHSC to negotiate master collective bargaining agreements for its employees. Authorizes a regional system of the Hawaii health systems corporation, in collaboration with a private entity, to transition any one or more of its facilities to management and operation by a new nonprofit management entity. Appropriates an unspecified amount to the department of budget and finance for an unspecified number of positions to coordinate the review of documents and examine the fiscal implications posed by a transition of any Hawaii health systems corporation facility to management and operation by a nonprofit management entity. Effective 1/7/2059. (SD2)

1112.last_action: Referred to EEP/WAL, FIN, referral sheet 6
1112.title: Environmental Response Revolving Fund; Wildlife Emergency Response
1112.description: Allows the environmental response revolving fund to be used to support the operations of an environmental disaster standby and response facility in the State that shall be responsible for the recovery and rehabilitation of native wildlife that are sickened, injured, or contaminated as a result of an oil- or fuel-related disaster in the State.

1113.last_action: The committee(s) on VMI recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
1113.title: Historic Preservation; Works of Art Special Fund; Use ($)
1113.description: Authorizes the use of moneys in the works of art special fund to be used for preventive maintenance, repair, rehabilitation, or restoration of the Bernice Pauahi Bishop Museum, Iolani Palace, Washington Place, Royal Mausoleum at Mauna Ala, No. 1 Capitol District Building, and the state capitol.

1114.last_action: The committee(s) on HUS recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.

1114.description: Amends the state supplemental payment amounts for specified types of adult residential care homes and other domiciliary care facilities and provides for annual adjustment. Changes the public assistance allowance to an unspecified percentage of the current federal poverty level.

1115.last_action: Referred to HLT, CPC, referral sheet 6
1115.title: Community Care Foster Family Homes; Caregivers; Minimum Age; Continuing Education
1115.description: Amends the minimum age and continuing education requirements for primary and substitute caregivers caring for three clients in community care foster family homes in the rules required to be adopted by the Department of Health.

1116.last_action: Referred to HLT, FIN, referral sheet 6

1116.description: Requires the Department of Health to pay interest on late payments to community health care facilities and case managers, and report back to the Legislature.

1117.last_action: Referred to VMI, WAL, FIN, referral sheet 6

1117.description: Directs the Office of Veterans' Services, with the assistance of the Department of Accounting and General Services, Department of Defense, and State Historic Preservation Division, to develop a plan to establish a memorial honoring the veterans of the Persian Gulf War, Operation Desert Storm, Operation Iraqi Freedom, Operation Enduring Freedom, and Operation New Dawn. Requires a report to the Legislature by January 1, 2016.

1118.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to WAM.
1118.title: Filipino Veterans; Burial Grants; Appropriation ($)
1118.description: Appropriates funds for burial grants for qualifying Filipino veterans to provide funeral and burial services and transportation of their remains to the Philippines.

1119.description: Requires that a percentage of the annual purchasing expenditure of the State set-aside for small businesses be awarded to veteran-owned and service-disabled veteran-owned small businesses, in addition to any other preferences provided under the Procurement Code for such businesses.

1120.last_action: Referred to EDN/HED, FIN, referral sheet 6

1120.description: Provides tuition incentives for public school students who complete their high school's graduation requirements before grade 12 and attend a college within the University of Hawaii system.

1121.description: Requires students to pass the United States citizenship exam in order to receive a high school diploma.

1122.description: Requires existing single-family homes to be retrofitted with solar water heater systems. Allows for a tax credit or loan for compliance. Authorizes the PUC to permit electrical utilities to collect a surcharge for non-compliance, to be deposited into the Hawaii green infrastructure special fund.

1123.last_action: Referred to HLT, CPC, referral sheet 6

1123.description: Adds definitions for "applied psychologist", "health service provider", and "general applied psychologist". Amends definitions of "practice of psychology" and "psychologist". Clarifies license and exemption requirements for psychologists. Amends powers and duties of the board of psychology.

1124.description: Removes the requirement that applicants for a license in psychology complete one year of post doctoral training and replaces it with required hours of supervised experience during the doctoral degree program.

1125.last_action: The committee on GVO deferred the measure.

1125.description: Requires the state procurement office to establish a database of all government procurement contracts, accessible to each governmental entity. Requires state procurement office oversight of procurement information. Appropriates funds to establish the database. (HB1126 HD1)

1126.last_action: Conference Committee Meeting will reconvene on Friday 05-01-15 2:40PM in conference room 016.
1126.title: Procurement; Procurement Officers; Education and Training; Appropriation ($)
1126.description: Requires all procurement officers of state and county governmental bodies to attend initial training by the State Procurement Office and regular follow-up training as determined by the State Procurement Office. Appropriates funds. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

1127.last_action: Referred to AGR, HSG, FIN, referral sheet 6
1127.title: Agricultural Land; Dwellings; Employee Housing
1127.description: Limits dwellings and employee housing on agricultural land to farmers and immediate family members. Establishes standards for dwellings and employee housing on agricultural land.

1128.title: Law Enforcement Officers; Firearms; Alcohol
1128.description: Prohibits law enforcement officers from consuming any amount of alcohol while in the possession on their person or control of a firearm.

1129.last_action: Referred to JUD, FIN, referral sheet 6
1129.title: Elections; Online Voting; Appropriation ($)
1129.description: Establishes a process for online voting by any registered voter for any election. Appropriates moneys to implement the process.

1130.last_action: Referred to JUD, FIN, referral sheet 6
1130.title: Campaign Contributions; Lobbyist
1130.description: Prohibits a candidate or candidate committee from accepting more than twenty per cent of its total contributions from lobbyists during an election period. Prohibits a lobbyist from contributing more than an aggregate $20,000 to all candidates and candidate committees during an election period.

1131.last_action: Referred to LAB, FIN, referral sheet 6
1131.title: Minimum Wage; Living Wage; Tip Credit; Consumer Price Index
1131.description: Establishes the minimum wage annually pursuant to the consumer price index. Adjusts the tip credit annually according to adjustments in the living wage.

1132.last_action: Referred to EDB, FIN, referral sheet 6

1132.description: Requires DBEDT to conduct a study on the establishment of tax-free zones in Hawaii.

1133.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Oshiro excused (1).
1133.title: Judiciary; Third Circuit; Hookele; Appropriations ($)
1133.description: Appropriates moneys for equipment, supplies, and salaries for Hookele legal self-help service centers in Hilo and Kona.

1134.last_action: The committee(s) on EEP recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.

1134.description: Establishes a nonrefundable income tax credit for taxpayers who participate in net energy metering and have unused credits for excess electricity that lapse before the credits can be applied to the taxpayer's utility bill.

1135.last_action: Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and C. Lee excused (1).

1135.description: Requires DOCARE to facilitate the execution of a memorandum of understanding for the joint enforcement of conservation laws, rules, and ordinances. Requires DOCARE to submit a report to the legislature. Sunsets on 6/30/16.

1136.description: Increases use tax paid by wholesalers from .5% to 1.5% by one per cent and applies the increase to reduce the State's unfunded liabilities for the EUTF and ERS.

1138.title: CIP; 20th Representative District ($)
1138.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects in the 20th representative district.

1139.description: Provides a temporary income tax credit for the cost of upgrading or converting a qualified cesspool to a septic system or an aerobic treatment unit system, or connecting to a sewer system. Permits DOH, as a pilot program, to certify no more than 2 residential large capacity cesspools as qualified cesspools. Defines terms. Effective 7/1/2015. Sunsets 12/31/2020. (CD1)

1140.last_action: Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to JDL.

1140.description: Prohibits new installation of a cesspool and new construction served by a cesspool after December 31, 2016. Authorizes the department of health to develop rules for exceptions. (SD1)

1141.description: Authorizes the issuance of general obligation bonds and appropriates funds for capital improvement projects in the sixth representative district.

1142.description: Establishes the definition of "lead agency" and provides that no other agency shall approve an action until the lead agency has accepted a final environmental impact statement.

1143.last_action: The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.

1143.description: Proposes an amendment to the Hawaii State Constitution guaranteeing that victims of crime and their surviving immediate family members have specific rights related to information pertaining to and participation in the criminal justice process.

1146.description: Establishes a two-year pilot emergency services failsafe program to assist physicians and patients in obtaining a second medical opinion regarding diagnosis and treatment. 1147.last_action: Referred to JUD, FIN, referral sheet 6

1147.description: Changes the closing time of polling places on election day to 7:00 p.m.

1149.description: Appropriates funds for capital improvement projects for the benefit of the 38th representative district.

1152.description: Exempts qualifying totally and permanently disabled veterans from paying the state motor vehicle registration fee. Requires the Director of the Office of Veterans Services to report the number of qualifying veterans to the Legislature and Department of Taxation. (HB1153 CD1)

1153.description: Increases the state vehicle registration fee, with proceeds to be deposited into the Disability and Communication Access Board Special Fund to cover the costs of administering the parking program for persons with disabilities. (HB1154 HD1)
